name: Clann Credo - Community Loan Finance
goal:
Clann Credo - the Social Enterprise Fund supports the development of social enterprise, community business, social impact investment (SII) and other innovative solutions to social problems.

It provides repayable finance, mainly loans, to social sector non-profit organisations on terms and conditions that are not available to them commercially.

It also seeks to provide an investment option to private investors who desire to align some of their portfolio with mission.

It itself is a self sufficient social enterprise and is a sustainable, alternative finance model serving communities and organisations that may have difficulty securing finance on reasonable terms;
a) It makes socially directed investments solely for charitable and/or public purposes at rates of interest and other terms which are more favourable than those that are currently available commercially,
b) It provides assistance with management development education.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Culture, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Regional Policy, Single market, Youth
euInitiatives: Social Business Initiative, Public Procurement, Structural Funds, EaSI, EIF, Regional Funds, Social Enterprise
